description: A frozen sea route filled with icebergs in Paradise (the first half of the Grand Line). This region is controlled by the Accino Family, who use it as their hunting grounds for capturing pirates.

keyEvents.title: Trap Kamome Deployment
keyEvents.description: Salchow activates Trap Kamome in the Hyokaido, using hundreds of fake Marine ships to drive the Straw Hats into an iceberg field.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of this frozen region and demonstration of the Accino Family's control over it.

keyEvents.title: Marine Fleet Ambush
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats find themselves surrounded by what appears to be a massive Marine fleet in the Hyokaido.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the dangerous nature of this frozen region and the Accino Family's tactical advantage.

statusHistory.reason: Frozen sea route controlled by the Accino Family

name.japanese: フェニックス海賊団の船

description: The damaged pirate ship belonging to the Phoenix Pirates, featuring a red phoenix figurehead. The ship was being towed by the Thousand Sunny after the crew encountered them.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Remains Aboard
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats discover Chopper is still on the Phoenix Pirates' ship, having stayed behind to treat Captain Puzzle.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the storyline where Chopper learns the Phoenix Pirates' history.

keyEvents.title: Jiro Reveals Phoenix Pirates Identity
keyEvents.description: Aboard their ship, Jiro reveals to Chopper that they are the Phoenix Pirates and tells their tragic story.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the setting for the major backstory revelation of the arc.

statusHistory.reason: Ship was damaged and being repaired while towed by the Thousand Sunny

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, built by Franky and the Galley-La Company. A brigantine-rigged sloop with advanced features including the Soldier Dock System.

keyEvents.title: Soldier Dock Channel 0 First Use
keyEvents.description: Franky activates the Thousand Sunny's Soldier Dock System Channel 0, deploying the Cola-Powered Paddle System for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: First demonstration of this advanced ship feature, showcasing Franky's engineering genius.

keyEvents.title: High-Speed Escape
keyEvents.description: Using the paddle system, the Thousand Sunny escapes the fake Marine fleet at tremendous speed while towing the Phoenix Pirates' ship.
keyEvents.significance: Proves the effectiveness of the ship's special systems in dangerous situations.

statusHistory.reason: Current ship of the Straw Hat Pirates

description: The Accino Family's island base, featuring a large castle-like structure. This is where the family coordinates their bounty hunting operations and stores their collection of pirate flags.

keyEvents.title: Accino Family Celebration
keyEvents.description: The Accino Family celebrates at Lovely Land with a toast to their near-success against the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the Accino Family's base and their celebratory family dynamic.

statusHistory.reason: Home base of the Accino Family

description: The second half of the Grand Line, known as the most dangerous sea in the world where only the strongest pirates can survive.

keyEvents.title: Phoenix Pirates' Defeat in New World
keyEvents.description: Jiro reveals that the Phoenix Pirates sailed into the New World but were heavily beaten there, losing their vice-captain Vigaro.
keyEvents.significance: Reinforces the extreme danger of the New World and foreshadows challenges the Straw Hats will eventually face.

keyEvents.title: Location of Vigaro's Death
keyEvents.description: The New World is revealed as the location where Vigaro died protecting the Phoenix Pirates crew.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the deadly consequences of attempting to sail the New World unprepared.
